summary: States get $16.5 billion a year in federal funding for the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families program, which provides cash and other assistance. States spend about another $15 billion. Questions have been raised about accountability in the use of these funds. This statement for the Congressional Record covers what we've seen so far in our ongoing work. title: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families: Preliminary Observations on State Budget Decisions, Single Audit Findings, and Fraud Risks
